sentences: Pienestä höyrystä nousi suuri pilvi. (A large cloud rose from the small steam.)
Höyry peitti kylpyhuoneen seinät. (Steam covered the bathroom walls.)
Juna kulki höyryn ja savun keskellä. (The train traveled amidst steam and smoke.)
context: The word 'höyry' in Finnish refers to steam or vapor, specifically gaseous state of a substance that is normally a solid or liquid. It can also refer to a cloud-like diffused matter suspended in the air. The declension shows different forms for singular and plural nouns, as well as possessive forms indicating who owns the steam (my steam, your steam, etc.). For example 'höyryni' means 'my steam', 'höyrymme' means 'our steam'. It is often used to describe water vapor but can also be applied to other substances. The word is related to similar words in Ingrian and Karelian languages.
